title: Shielded by Russia and China, Myanmar’s Tactics Turn More Brutal
description: When Myanmar carried out the death penalty for the first time in three decades by executing four activists in July, China and Russia stayed silent while the US and its allies condemned the junta. Now the regime is on the verge of doing it again.

title: Biden Signs $1.7 Trillion Funding Bill That Includes Ukraine Aid
description: President Joe Biden signed a $1.7 trillion government funding bill that includes $47 billion in additional aid for Ukraine in a victory for Democrats who feared that Republicans who will have control of the House in January could force deeper spending cuts and block assistance to Kyiv.

title: Brazil’s Lula Taps Amazon Defender, New Ally in Bid to Diversify Cabinet
description: Marina Silva

title: Bankman-Fried Met With White House Aides on Crypto Policy Before FTX Collapse
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the now-disgraced cryptocurrency mogul, held at least four meetings with senior White House officials this year — part of a push to influence crypto policy and build connections in Washington before his FTX empire ultimately collapsed.

title: Chinese Jet Buzzed Air Force Plane From Just 20 Feet Away, US Says
description: GUANGZHOU, Sept. 13, 2016 -- A Chinese Air Force J-11 fighter flies to the West Pacific, via the Bashi Strait, for a routine combat simulation drill, Sept. 12, 2016. The Chinese Air Force on Monday sent multiple aircraft models, including H-6K bombers, Su-30 fighters, and air tankers, for the drill. The fleet conducted reconnaissance and early warning, sea surface cruising, inflight refueling, and achieved all the drill's targets. (Xinhua/Fan Yishu via Getty Images)

title: US Weighs Sending Bradley Fighting Vehicles to Bolster Ukraine
description: The US government is considering sending Bradley Fighting Vehicles to Ukraine as part of a further package of military support, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: UK Won’t Be Held to Ransom by Striking Unions, Minister Says
description: UK ministers won’t be held to ransom by striking workers calling for more pay, Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said, as the government grapples with a wave of industrial action hitting hospitals, the railways and airports.

title: US Ignored Own Scientists' Warning in Backing Atlantic Wind Farm
description: The recommendation underscores a potential environmental tradeoff of the coming offshore wind boom along the US East Coast.

title: Trump Tax Returns' Release to Start Tit-for-Tat Battle in Congress, GOP Aide Says
description: Democrats’ plans to release former President Donald Trump’s tax returns could be the start of a tit-for-tat battle using Internal Revenue Service documents to target political foes, a Republican aide said.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu Sworn in as Israel’s Premier Once More
description: Benjamin Netanyahu was sworn in as Israel’s new prime minister on Thursday, following a vote approving his cabinet that cements his political return after just 18 months in opposition.

title: Europe’s Health Officials Oppose Restrictions on China Travel
description: European health officials called screenings and restrictions on travelers from China unjustified.

title: Biden Lawyer Says GOP Must Restart Oversight Requests Next Year
description: A lawyer for President Joe Biden told Republican lawmakers the administration did not plan to respond to letters seeking information for potential House probes, telling them they needed to resend those requests once they take over their committees in the next Congress.

title: Egypt Eases Import Rule That Had Stymied Market Amid FX Crunch
description: Egypt’s central bank revoked a requirement for importers to secure letters of credit, a rule that had been blamed for a massive backlog at ports.

title: Belarus Says Its Air Defense Shot Down Ukrainian Missile
description: Belarus said its air defenses shot down a Ukrainian S-300 surface-to-air missile that flew into its territory Thursday — a rare instance of the war spilling over the border into Russia’s ally, where an official downplayed the incident.

title: Vatican: Benedict XVI Lucid, Stable, But Condition 'Serious'
description: Vatican City (AP) -- Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI is lucid, conscious and stable but his condition remains serious, the Vatican said Thursday, a day after it revealed that the 95-year-old's health had deteriorated recently.

title: Italy’s Meloni Urges EU to Work on Way to Counter US Aid Package
description: Giorgia Meloni, Italy's prime minister, during her first year-end press conference in Rome, Italy, on Thursday, Dec. 29, 2022. The US and Italy joined an increasing number of nations requiring Covid tests for travelers from China, with concerns mounting over the risk of any new variants emerging from the surge in infections in the country of 1.4 billion.

title: Top Spanish Court Endorses Judges as Clash With PM Sánchez Cools
description: Spain’s Constitutional Court backed the nomination of four new judges on Thursday, defusing a simmering dispute with Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez and favoring a shift to the left.

title: India Probes Uzbekistan Claim That 18 Kids Killed by Cough Syrup
description: India is investigating claims made by Uzbekistan’s government that 18 children died after ingesting a cough syrup brand made in the South Asian nation just two months after a similar tragedy was reported in Gambia.

title: Italian Parliament Backs Meloni Budget of More Than €30 Billion
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni won the final green light from parliament for her economic plans for next year.

title: Turkey to Earmark $13 Billion For Early Retirement Ballot Pledge
description: Turkey’s government wants to set aside at least $13 billion a year to offer early retirement to millions of citizens in a key election pledge.

title: Who’s the Divisive Politician About to Head Israel’s Finances?
description: Bezalel Smotrich says he’ll pursue free-market policies and supports expanding the budget for religious education

title: India Finance Minister Sitharaman Gets Discharged From Hospital
description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was discharged from the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi on Thursday, government officials said.

title: Israel Swears in Netanyahu as PM of Hard-line Government
description: Jerusalem (AP) -- Benjamin Netanyahu was sworn into office Thursday, taking the helm of the most right-wing and religiously conservative government in Israel’s history and vowing to enact policies that could cause domestic and regional turmoil and alienate the country’s closest allies.

title: Russia Fires Heavy Salvo on Ukraine, Ruling Out Peace Talks
description: Russia rained scores of missiles on Ukrainian cities in one of its heaviest barrages of the war, pressing further with a campaign to destroy civilian targets as Moscow spurned the prospects of talks to end the invasion.

title: China Calls on US to ‘Create the Conditions’ for Military Talks
description: China said it is up to the US to take steps toward resuming high-level military discussions that were suspended after Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, comments that hint at lingering tensions between the world’s two largest economies.

title: South Korea Leader Seeks ‘Overwhelming’ Military Power Over Kim
description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said he wants to put South Korea on a path of overwhelming military strength against North Korea and pledged to boost defenses against drones after his neighbor sent five across the border this week.

title: Portuguese Minister Resigns Over TAP Payment to Airline’s Board Member
description: Portuguese minister Pedro Nuno Santos resigned following criticism about the compensation paid earlier this year to a board member for leaving TAP SA, the state-owned airline that’s receiving more than €2 billion ($2.1 billion) of government aid.

title: Russia Rules Out Peace Talks With Ukraine, Says It Won’t Give Up
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Moscow won’t enter into negotiations with Ukraine to end the war, even after suffering a series of battlefield setbacks.

title: Ukraine Latest: Russia Launches Major Missile Barrage; Kyiv Hit
description: Russia launched another large-scale missile barrage against Ukraine, with major cities including the capital Kyiv and Lviv in the west near the border with Poland coming under attack, according to reports from officials and witness accounts.

title: Malaysia Opposition Wants By-Elections After Some MPs Back Anwar
description: A Malaysian opposition party is demanding recall elections be held in four constituencies, after some of its lawmakers from the Borneo state of Sabah openly backed Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

title: Marcos to Raise South China Sea Issue With China During Visit
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. will raise the territorial dispute in the South China Sea with Beijing during his visit there next week and may also pursue energy cooperation talks.

title: Here Are the Places Imposing New Covid Rules for China Travelers
description: China may be reopening, allowing its 1.4 billion people to come and go largely without restrictions, but just as it is, a slew of other countries are tightening measures for travelers from the world’s second-biggest economy, concerned the tsunami of virus cases there may spawn new Covid variants.

title: Philippine Health Dept: No Need to Restrict Chinese Visitors
description: The Philippines’ top health official said there’s no need yet to shut the country’s borders or impose tighter Covid restrictions on inbound Chinese travelers, bucking moves by other nations like the US to require tests for visitors from China amid a renewed surge in infections there.

title: Massive Fire At Cambodia Hotel Casino Kills At Least 16
description: Phnom Penh, Cambodia (AP) -- A massive fire that lasted more than 12 hours in a Cambodian hotel casino killed at least 16 people and injured about 50, while other victims were apparently not yet accounted for Thursday, as neighboring Thailand sent firetrucks to help fight the blaze in a bustling border town.

title: Pakistan Army Vows to Eliminate Taliban Offshoot as Attacks Rise
description: Pakistan’s army said it will act against terrorists and eliminate the “menace,” signaling a military operation against the local offshoot of the Afghan Taliban that has resumed attacks across the South Asian nation.

title: Indonesia to Keep Loose Entry Rules for Chinese Visitors
description: Indonesia has no plans to tighten restrictions for travelers from China, keeping its looser Covid-19 policy for international visitors despite a recent surge in cases.

title: Australian Minister Raises Hopes for Trade Thaw With China
description: Australia would be willing to reconsider its case against China at the World Trade Organization if Beijing’s sanctions against its exports were lifted, as Trade Minister Don Farrell flagged a potential thaw in the trade tensions between the two countries.

title: Serbs Agree to Unblock Roads in Kosovo But Tensions Still Simmer
description: Serbs in Kosovo agreed to start removing road barricades erected in protest against the largely ethnic-Albanian government, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said, even as he vowed to protect demonstrators that have raised the specter of renewed conflict.
